:Brightlite:FuelfabFacility.doc: A fuelfab facility is provided as a skeleton for the design of new facility agents.
:Brightlite:FuelfabFacility.name: fuelfab::FuelfabFacility

in_commods.doc: A list of the commodities that this facility can recieve

maximum_storage.tooltip: maximum storage capacity of the facility

:Brightlite:ReactorFacility.doc: A reactor facility is provided as a skeleton for the design of new facility agents.
:Brightlite:ReactorFacility.name: reactor::ReactorFacility

CR_fissile.tooltip: List of fissile isotopes for conversion ratio calculation.

CR_lower.tooltip: Lower bound of the fission product mass number for conversion ratio calculation.

CR_upper.tooltip: Upper bound of the fission product mass number for conversion ratio calculation.

SS_tolerance.tooltip: The steady state calculation tolerance for the code

cylindrical_delta.tooltip: Delta to be used for cylindrical flux calculation.

disadv_a.tooltip: Fuel pin radius used for thermal disadvantage calculation.

disadv_b.tooltip: Moderator radius used for thermal disadvantage calculation.

disadv_fuel_sigs.tooltip: Fuel macroscopic scattering cross-section for thermal disadvantage calculation.

disadv_mod_siga.tooltip: Moderator macroscopic abs cross-section for thermal disadvantage calculation.

disadv_mod_sigs.tooltip: Moderator macroscopic scattering cross-section for thermal disadvantage calculation.

fuel_Sig_tr.tooltip: Macroscopic transport cross section of the fuel.

fuel_area.tooltip: Total area of the fuel in core. Used for cylindrical flux calculation.

in_commods.doc: commodity that the brightlite reactor consumes

tooltip: interpolation pairs used for the library

libraries.doc: the reactor's burnup & criticality behavior to use

max_inv_size.doc: total maximum inventory size of the reactor

mod_Sig_a.tooltip: Macroscopic absorption cross section of the moderator.

mod_Sig_f.tooltip: Macroscopic fission cross section of the moderator.

mod_Sig_tr.tooltip: Macroscopic transport cross section of the moderator.

mod_thickness.tooltip: Radial thickness of the moderator used for cylindrical flux calculation.

outage_time.label: Outage Period
outage_time.tooltip: The amount of time the reactor is offline to load new fuel and shuffle older fuel

reactor_life.tooltip: Time before reactor is shutdown after startup.

tolerance.tooltip: The blending convergence requirement for the code

:Brightlite:ReprocessFacility.doc: A reprocess facility is provided as a skeleton for the design of new facility agents.
:Brightlite:ReprocessFacility.name: reprocess::ReprocessFacility

in_commod.doc: commodity that the brightlite reprocess facility consumes

max_inv_size.doc: total maximum inventory size of the reactor

:agents:KFacility.doc: A facility designed for integration tests that both provides and consumes commodities. It changes its request and offer amounts based on a power law with respect to time.
:agents:KFacility.name: cyclus::KFacility

current_capacity.doc: number of output commodity units that can be supplied at the current time step (infinite capacity can be represented by a very large number

in_capacity.doc: number of commodity units that can be taken at each time step (infinite capacity can be represented by a very large number

k_factor_in.doc: conversion factor that governs the behavior of the k-facility's input commodity capacity

k_factor_out.doc: conversion factor that governs the behavior of the k-facility's output commodity capacity

max_inv_size.doc: total maximum inventory size of the k-facility

out_capacity.doc: number of commodity units that can be supplied at each time step (infinite capacity can be represented by a very large number

recipe_name.doc: recipe name for the k-facility's in-commodity

:agents:NullInst.doc: An instition that owns facilities in the simulation but exhibits null behavior. No parameters are given when using the null institution.
:agents:NullInst.name: cyclus::NullInst

:agents:NullRegion.doc: A region that owns the simulation's institutions but exhibits null behavior. No parameters are given when using the null region.
:agents:NullRegion.name: cyclus::NullRegion

:agents:Predator.doc: A facility that represents predators in the Lotka-Volterra integration tests
:agents:Predator.name: cyclus::Predator

age.doc: age of predator at beginning of simulation

birth_and_death.doc: whether or not simultaneous birth and and death are allowed (i.e., can a facility give birth and die in the same time step?)

consumed.doc: how many units of prey consumed per time step

dead.doc: flag for whether predator is currently dead

full.doc: how many units of prey a predator consumes until it is satisfied

hunt_cap.doc: how many units of prey a predator can catch during a hunt

hunt_factor.doc: whether or not to base hunting success on relative predator/prey populations

hunt_freq.doc: how often a predator needs to hunt

nchildren.doc: number of predator children born at each birthing instance

success.doc: fraction of hunting success on a scale from 0 to 1

:agents:Prey.doc: A facility that represents prey in the Lotka-Volterra integration tests
:agents:Prey.name: cyclus::Prey

age.doc: age of prey at start of simulation

birth_and_death.doc: whether or not simultaneous birth and and death are allowed (i.e., can a facility give birth and die in the same time step?)

birth_freq.doc: number of time steps between birth of children

dead.doc: flag for whether prey is currently dead

nchildren.doc: number of children born at each birthing instance

:agents:Sink.doc: A minimum implementation sink facility that accepts specified amounts of commodities from other agents
:agents:Sink.name: cyclus::Sink

capacity.doc: capacity the sink facility can accept at each time step

in_commods.doc: commodities that the sink facility accepts

max_inv_size.doc: total maximum inventory size of sink facility

recipe_name.doc: Name of recipe to request.If empty, sink requests material no particular composition.

:agents:Source.doc: A minimum implementation source facility that provides a commodity with a given capacity
:agents:Source.name: cyclus::Source

capacity.doc: amount of commodity that can be supplied at each time step

commod.doc: commodity that the source facility supplies

recipe_name.doc: Recipe name for source facility's commodity.If empty, source supplies material with requested compositions.

:cycaless:BatchReactor.doc: A reactor facility that has three storage areas that hold batches of materials: reserves, core, and storage. It can manage multiple input-output commodity pairs.
:cycaless:BatchReactor.name: cycaless::BatchReactor

crctx_.doc: in-out commodity and fuel recipe mappings

:cycaless:DeployInst.doc: An institution that owns, operates, and deploys facilities manually defined in the input file.
:cycaless:DeployInst.name: cycamore::DeployInst

build_sched_.doc: list of times to build specific facilities

:cycamore:DeployInst.doc: Builds and manages agents (facilities) according to a manually specified deployment schedule. Deployed agents are automatically decommissioned at the end of their lifetime.  The user specifies a list of prototypes for each and corresponding build times, number to build, and (optionally) lifetimes.  The same prototype can be specified multiple times with any combination of the same or different build times, build number, and lifetimes.
:cycamore:DeployInst.name: cycamore::DeployInst

build_times.doc: Time step on which to build agents given in prototypes (same order).

lifetimes.doc: Lifetimes for each prototype in protos (same order). These lifetimes override the lifetimes in the original prototype definition. If unspecified, lifetimes from the original prototype definitions are used. Although a new prototype is created in the Prototypes table for each lifetime with the suffix '_life_[lifetime]', all deployed agents themselves will have the same original prototype name (and so will the Agents tables).

n_build.doc: Number of each prototype in prototypes var to build (same order).

prototypes.doc: Ordered list of prototypes to build.

:cycamore:Enrichment.doc: An enrichment facility that intakes a commodity (usually natural uranium) and supplies a user-specified enriched product based on SWU capacity
:cycamore:Enrichment.name: cycamore::Enrichment

feed_commod.doc: feed commodity that the enrichment facility accepts

feed_recipe.doc: recipe for enrichment facility feed commodity

initial_feed.doc: amount of natural uranium stored at the enrichment facility at the beginning of the simulation (kg)

max_enrich.doc: maximum allowed weight fraction of U235 in product

max_feed_inventory.doc: maximum total inventory of natural uranium in the enrichment facility (kg)

order_prefs.doc: turn on preference ordering for input material so that EF chooses higher U235 content first
order_prefs.tooltip: order material requests by U235 content

product_commod.doc: product commodity that the enrichment facility generates

swu_capacity.doc: separative work unit (SWU) capacity of enrichment facility (kgSWU/month)

tails_assay.doc: tails assay from the enrichment process

tails_commod.doc: tails commodity supplied by enrichment facility

:cycamore:FuelFab.doc:
FuelFab takes in 2 streams of material and mixes them in ratios in order to supply material that matches some neutronics properties of reqeusted material.  It uses an equivalence type method [1] inspired by a similar approach in the COSI fuel cycle simulator.

The FuelFab has 3 input inventories: fissile stream, filler stream, and an optional top-up inventory.  All materials received into each inventory are always combined into a single material (i.e. a single fissile material, a single filler material, etc.).  The input streams and requested fuel composition are each assigned weights based on summing:

    N * (p_i - p_U238) / (p_Pu239 - p_U238)

for each nuclide where:

    - p = nu*sigma_f - sigma_a   for the nuclide
    - p_U238 is p for pure U238
    - p_Pu239 is p for pure Pu239
    - N is the nuclide's atom fraction
    - nu is the average # neutrons per fission
    - sigma_f is the microscopic fission cross-section
    - sigma_a is the microscopic neutron absorption cross-section

The cross sections are from the simple cross section library in PyNE. They can be set to either a thermal or fast neutron spectrum.  A linear interpolation is performed using the weights of the fissile, filler, and target streams. The interpolation is used to compute a mixing ratio of the input streams that matches the target weight.  In the event that the target weight is higher than the fissile stream weight, the FuelFab will attempt to use the top-up and fissile input streams together instead of the fissile and filler streams.  All supplied material will always have the same weight as the requested material.

The supplying of mixed material is constrained by available inventory quantities and a per time step throughput limit.  Requests for fuel material larger than the throughput can never be met.  Fissile inventory can be requested/received via one or more commodities.  The DRE request preference for each of these commodities can also optionally be specified. By default, the top-up inventory size is zero, and it is not used for mixing. 

[1] Baker, A. R., and R. W. Ross. "Comparison of the value of plutonium and    uranium isotopes in fast reactors." Proceedings of the Conference on    Breeding. Economics, and Safety in Large Fast Power Reactors. 1963.
:cycamore:FuelFab.name: cycamore::FuelFab

fill_commod.doc: Commodity on which to request material for filler stream.

fill_recipe.doc: Name of recipe to be used in filler material stream requests.

fill_size.doc: Size of filler material stream inventory.

fiss_commod_prefs.doc: Fissile stream commodity request preferences for each of the given fissile commodities (same order). If unspecified, default is to use zero for all preferences.

fiss_commods.doc: Ordered list of commodities on which to requesting fissile stream material.

fiss_recipe.doc: Name for recipe to be used in fissile stream requests. Empty string results in use of an empty dummy recipe.

fiss_size.doc: Size of fissile material stream inventory.

outcommod.doc: Commodity on which to offer/supply mixed fuel material.

spectrum.doc: The type of cross-sections to use for composition property calculation. Use 'fission_spectrum_ave' for fast reactor compositions or 'thermal' for thermal reactors.

throughput.doc: Maximum number of kg of fuel material that can be supplied per time step.

topup_commod.doc: Commodity on which to request material for top-up stream. This MUST be set if 'topup_size > 0'.

topup_recipe.doc: Name of recipe to be used in top-up material stream requests. This MUST be set if 'topup_size > 0'.

topup_size.doc: Size of top-up material stream inventory.

:cycamore:GrowthRegion.doc: A region that governs a scenario in which there is growth in demand for a commodity.
:cycamore:GrowthRegion.name: cycamore::GrowthRegion

commodity_name.doc: name of the commodity experiencing a growth in demand

demand_params.doc: parameters that define the behavior of the demand type function

demand_times.doc: vector describing the length of times regarding the piecewise demand type

demand_types.doc: mathematical description of demand growth (i.e., linear, exponential, piecewise)

:cycamore:ManagerInst.doc: An institution that owns and operates a manually entered list of facilities in the input file
:cycamore:ManagerInst.name: cycamore::ManagerInst

prototypes.doc: a facility to be managed by the institution

:cycamore:Reactor.doc:
Reactor is a simple, general reactor based on static compositional transformations to model fuel burnup.  The user specifies a set of input fuels and corresponding burnt compositions that fuel is transformed to when it is discharged from the core.  No incremental transmutation takes place. Rather, at the end of an operational cycle, the batch being discharged from the core is instantaneously transmuted from its original fresh fuel composition into its spent fuel form.

Each fuel is identified by a specific input commodity and has an associated input recipe (nuclide composition), output recipe, output commidity, and preference.  The preference identifies which input fuels are preferred when requesting.  Changes in these preferences can be specified as a function of time using the pref_change variables.  Changes in the input-output recipe compositions can also be specified as a function of time using the recipe_change variables.

The reactor treats fuel as individual assemblies that are never split, combined or otherwise treated in any non-discrete way.  Fuel is requested in full-or-nothing assembly sized quanta.  If real-world assembly modeling is unnecessary, parameters can be adjusted (e.g. n_assem_core, assem_size, n_assem_batch).  At the end of every cycle, a full batch is discharged from the core consisting of n_assem_batch assemblies of assem_size kg. The reactor also has a specifiable refueling time period following the end of each cycle at the end of which it will resume operation on the next cycle *if* it has enough fuel for a full core; otherwise it waits until it has enough fresh fuel assemblies.

In addition to its core, the reactor has an on-hand fresh fuel inventory and a spent fuel inventory whose capacities are specified by n_assem_fresh and n_assem_spent respectively.  Each time step the reactor will attempt to acquire enough fresh fuel to fill its fresh fuel inventory (and its core if the core isn't currently full).  If the fresh fuel inventory has zero capacity, fuel will be ordered just-in-time after the end of each operational cycle before the next begins.  If the spent fuel inventory becomes full, the reactor will halt operation at the end of the next cycle until there is more room.  Each time step, the reactor will try to trade away as much of its spent fuel inventory as possible.
:cycamore:Reactor.name: cycamore::Reactor

cycle_step.doc: Number of time steps since the start of the last cycle. Only set this if you know what you are doing

cycle_time.doc: The duration of a full operational cycle (excluding refueling time) in time steps.

discharged.doc: This should NEVER be set manually.

fuel_incommods.doc: Ordered list of input commodities on which to requesting fuel.

fuel_inrecipes.doc: Fresh fuel recipes to request for each of the given fuel input commodities (same order).

fuel_outcommods.doc: Output commodities on which to offer spent fuel originally received as each particular  input commodity (same order).

fuel_outrecipes.doc: Spent fuel recipes corresponding to the given fuel input commodities (same order). Fuel received via a particular input commodity is transmuted to the recipe specified here after being burned during a cycle.

fuel_prefs.doc: The preference for each type of fresh fuel requested corresponding to each input commodity (same order).  If no preferences are specified, zero is used for all fuel requests (default).

n_assem_batch.doc: Number of assemblies that constitute a single batch.This is the number of assemblies discharged from the core fully burned each cycle.Batch size is equivalent to ``n_assem_batch / n_assem_core``.

n_assem_core.doc: Number of assemblies that constitute a full core.

n_assem_fresh.doc: Number of fresh fuel assemblies to keep on-hand if possible.

n_assem_spent.doc: Number of spent fuel assemblies that can be stored on-site before reactor operation stalls.

power_cap.doc: Amount of electrical power the facility produces when operating normally.

power_name.doc: The name of the 'power' commodity used in conjunction with a deployment curve.

pref_change_commods.doc: The input commodity for a particular fuel preference change. Same order as and direct correspondence to the specified preference change times.

pref_change_times.doc: A time step on which to change the request preference for a particular fresh fuel type.

pref_change_values.doc: The new/changed request preference for a particular fresh fuel. Same order as and direct correspondence to the specified preference change times.

recipe_change_commods.doc: The input commodity indicating fresh fuel for which recipes will be changed. Same order as and direct correspondence to the specified recipe change times.

recipe_change_in.doc: The new input recipe to use for this recipe change. Same order as and direct correspondence to the specified recipe change times.

recipe_change_out.doc: The new output recipe to use for this recipe change. Same order as and direct correspondence to the specified recipe change times.

recipe_change_times.doc: A time step on which to change the input-output recipe pair for a requested fresh fuel.

refuel_time.doc: The duration of a full refueling period - the minimum time between a cycle end and the start of the next cycle.

res_indexes.doc: This should NEVER be set manually.

:cycamore:Separations.doc:
Separations processes feed material into one or more streams containing specific elements and/or nuclides.  It uses mass-based efficiencies.

User defined separations streams are specified as groups of component-efficiency pairs where 'component' means either a particular element or a particular nuclide.  Each component's paired efficiency represents the mass fraction of that component in the feed that is separated into that stream.  The efficiencies of a particular component across all streams must sum up to less than or equal to one.  If less than one, the remainining material is sent to a waste inventory and (potentially) traded away from there.

The facility receives material into a feed inventory that it processes with a specified throughput each time step.  Each output stream has a corresponding output inventory size/limit.  If the facility is unable to reduce its stocks by trading and hits this limit for any of its output streams, further processing/separations of feed material will halt until room is again available in the output streams.
:cycamore:Separations.name: cycamore::Separations

feed_commod_prefs.doc: Feed commodity request preferences for each of the given feed commodities (same order). If unspecified, default is to use zero for all preferences.

feed_commods.doc: Ordered list of commodities on which to request feed material to separate. Order only matters for matching up with feed commodity preferences if specified.

feed_recipe.doc: Name for recipe to be used in feed requests. Empty string results in use of a dummy recipe.

feedbuf_size.doc: Maximum amount of feed material to keep on hand.

leftover_commod.doc: Commodity on which to trade the leftover separated material stream. This MUST NOT be the same as any commodity used to define the other separations streams.

leftoverbuf_size.doc: Maximum amount of leftover separated material (not included in any other stream) that can be stored. If full, the facility halts operation until space becomes available.

streams_.doc: Output streams for separations. Each stream must have a unique name identifying the commodity on which its material is traded, a max buffer capacity in kg (neg values indicate infinite size), and a set of component efficiencies. 'comp' is a component to be separated into the stream (e.g. U, Pu, etc.) and 'eff' is the mass fraction of the component that is separated from the feed into this output stream. If any stream buffer is full, the facility halts operation until space becomes available. The sum total of all component efficiencies across streams must be less than or equal to 1 (e.g. sum of U efficiencies for all streams must be <= 1).

throughput.doc: Maximum quantity of feed material that can be processed per time step.

:cycamore:Sink.doc: A sink facility that accepts specified amounts of commodities from other agents
:cycamore:Sink.name: cycamore::Sink

capacity.doc: capacity the sink facility can accept at each time step

in_commods.doc: commodities that the sink facility accepts

max_inv_size.doc: total maximum inventory size of sink facility

recipe_name.doc: name of recipe to use for material requests, where the default (empty string) is to accept everything

:cycamore:Source.doc:
This facility acts as a source of material with a fixed throughput (per
 time step) capacity and a lifetime capacity defined by a total inventory
 size.  It offers its material as a single commodity. If a composition
 recipe is specified, it provides that single material composition to
 requesters.  If unspecified, the source provides materials with the exact
 requested compositions.  The inventory size and throughput both default to
 infinite.  Supplies material results in corresponding decrease in
 inventory, and when the inventory size reaches zero, the source can provide
 no more material.
:cycamore:Source.name: cycamore::Source

inventory_size.doc: Total amount of material this source has remaining. Every trade decreases this value by the supplied material quantity'. When it reaches zero, the source cannot provide any more material.

outcommod.doc: Output commodity on which the source offers material.

outrecipe.doc: Name of composition recipe that this source provides regardless of requested composition. If empty, source creates and provides whatever compositions are requested.
outrecipe.tooltip: name of material recipe to provide

throughput.doc: amount of commodity that can be supplied at each time step

schema.:Brightlite:FuelfabFacility:
<interleave>
    <optional>
        <element name="maximum_storage">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <element name="fissle_stream">
        <data type="string"/>
    </element>
    <element name="non_fissle_stream">
        <data type="string"/>
    </element>
    <element name="in_commods">
        <oneOrMore>
            <element name="key">
                <data type="string"/>
            </element>
            <element name="val">
                <data type="double"/>
            </element>
        </oneOrMore>
    </element>
    <element name="out_commod">
        <data type="string"/>
    </element>
</interleave>
schema.:Brightlite:ReactorFacility:
<interleave>
    <optional>
        <element name="tolerance">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="SS_tolerance">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="disadv_a">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="disadv_b">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="disadv_mod_siga">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="disadv_mod_sigs">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="disadv_fuel_sigs">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <element name="in_commods">
        <oneOrMore>
            <element name="val">
                <data type="string"/>
            </element>
        </oneOrMore>
    </element>
    <element name="out_commod">
        <data type="string"/>
    </element>
    <element name="libraries">
        <oneOrMore>
            <element name="val">
                <data type="string"/>
            </element>
        </oneOrMore>
    </element>
    <optional>
        <element name="interpol_pairs">
            <oneOrMore>
                <element name="key">
                    <data type="string"/>
                </element>
                <element name="val">
                    <data type="double"/>
                </element>
            </oneOrMore>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="batches">
            <data type="int"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="nonleakage">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="max_inv_size">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="target_burnup">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <element name="generated_power">
        <data type="double"/>
    </element>
    <element name="core_mass">
        <data type="double"/>
    </element>
    <optional>
        <element name="efficiency">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="fuel_area">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="cylindrical_delta">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="mod_Sig_a">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>
    </optional>
    <optional>
        <element name="mod_Sig_tr">
            <data type="double"/>
        </element>

schema.:cycaless:BatchReactor:
<!-- cyclus::Material In/Out  -->           
  <element name="fuel">                     
  <oneOrMore>                                 
    <element name="incommodity"><text/></element>
    <element name="inrecipe"><text/></element>
    <element name="outcommodity"><text/></element>
    <element name="outrecipe"><text/></element>
  </oneOrMore>                                
  </element>                                  
  <!-- Facility Parameters -->                
  <interleave>                                
  <element name="processtime">              
    <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/>       
  </element>                                  
  <element name="nbatches">                 
    <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/>       
  </element>                                  
  <element name ="batchsize">               
    <data type="double"/>                   
  </element>                                  
  <optional>                                  
    <element name ="refueltime">            
      <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/>     
    </element>                                
  </optional>                                 
  <optional>                                  
    <element name ="orderlookahead">        
      <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/>     
    </element>                                
  </optional>                                 
  <optional>                                  
    <element name ="norder">                
      <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/>     
    </element>                                
  </optional>                                 
  <optional>                                  
    <element name ="nreload">               
      <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/>     
    </element>                                
  </optional>                                 
  <optional>                                  
    <element name ="initial_condition">     
      <optional>                              
        <element name ="reserves">          
         <element name ="nbatches">         
          <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/> 
         </element>                           
         <element name ="commodity">        
          <data type="string"/>             
         </element>                           
         <element name ="recipe">           
          <data type="string"/>             
         </element>                           
        </element>                            
      </optional>                             
      <optional>                              
        <element name ="core">              
        <element name ="nbatches">          
          <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/> 
        </element>                            
        <element name ="commodity">         
          <data type="string"/>             
        </element>                            
        <element name ="recipe">            
          <data type="string"/>             
        </element>                            
        </element>                            
      </optional>                             
      <optional>                              
        <element name ="storage">           
        <element name ="nbatches">          
          <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/> 
        </element>                            
        <element name ="commodity">         
          <data type="string"/>             
        </element>                            
        <element name ="recipe">            
          <data type="string"/>             
        </element>                            
        </element>                            
      </optional>                             
    </element>                                
  </optional>                                 
                                              
  <!-- Recipe Changes  -->                    
  <optional>                                  
  <element name="recipe_change">            
  <oneOrMore>                                 
   <element name="incommodity">             
     <data type="string"/>                  
   </element>                                 
   <element name="new_recipe">              
     <data type="string"/>                  
   </element>                                 
   <element name="time">                    
     <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/>      
   </element>                                 
  </oneOrMore>                                
  </element>                                  
  </optional>                                 
  </interleave>                               
                                              
  <!-- Power Production  -->                  
  <element name="commodity_production">     
   <element name="commodity">               
     <data type="string"/>                  
   </element>                                 
   <element name="capacity">                
     <data type="double"/>                  
   </element>                                 
   <element name="cost">                    
     <data type="double"/>                  
   </element>                                 
  </element>                                  
                                              
  <!-- Trade Preferences  -->                 
  <optional>                                  
  <element name="commod_pref">              
  <oneOrMore>                                 
   <element name="incommodity">             
     <data type="string"/>                  
   </element>                                 
   <element name="preference">              
     <data type="double"/>                  
   </element>                                 
  </oneOrMore>                                
  </element>                                  
  </optional>                                 
                                              
  <!-- Trade Preference Changes  -->          
  <optional>                                  
  <element name="pref_change">              
  <oneOrMore>                                 
   <element name="incommodity">             
     <data type="string"/>                  
   </element>                                 
   <element name="new_pref">                
     <data type="double"/>                  
   </element>                                 
   <element name="time">                    
     <data type="nonNegativeInteger"/>      
   </element>                                 
  </oneOrMore>                                
  </element>                                  
  </optional>

</element>
